. After doing some research, it looks like imagemagick supports outputting the diffImage to stdout:
``` bash
No output image is generated but piped to /dev/null
compare -verbose -metric RMSE -highlight-color RED -compose Src checkerboard.png white.png - 1> /dev/null
```
We can prob coerce options.diffImage to - when it's falsy to handle this case. However, then we will start to generate a buffer of the diff image which is wasteful (child_process.exec doesn't support ignoring this):
https://nodejs.org/api/child_process.html#child_process_child_process_exec_command_options_callback
As a result, we should switch to child_process.spawn and use ignore for stdio on stdout:
https://nodejs.org/api/child_process.html#child_process_child_process_spawn_command_args_options
https://nodejs.org/api/child_process.html#child_process_options_stdio

Various notes on the race conditions:

imagesAreSame should use a callback with the boolean result from imageDiff.getFullResult. The current setup is attempting to use it synchronously when it doesn't/can't return anything; it can only callback =/
request.head and request().pipe() aren't doing any error checking
mkdirp should be mkdirp.sync or use a callback before getting to the setInterval piece

wrote:

@feistar https://github.com/feistar There are a bunch of asynchronous
functions being called in a synchronous manner (e.g. mkdirp should be
using mkdirp.sync or placing the rest of the code in its callback to
verify the directory exists). However, none of them seem to look like they
would cause a SIGKILL =/
Is it possible that there are multiples of the same image being
downloaded? If so, then ImageMagick might self terminate when the file it
was talking to vanishes
Various notes on the race conditions:

imagesAreSame should use a callback with the boolean result from
   imageDiff.getFullResult. The current setup is attempting to use it
   synchronously when it doesn't/can't return anything; it can only callback =/
request.head and request().pipe() aren't doing any error checking
mkdirp should be mkdirp.sync or use a callback before getting to the
   setInterval piece

I should also note that if you are doing image comparison for images that
consistently the same size, you can skip image-diff and use pixelmatch
which does everything in memory so you won't need to manage files:
https://github.com/mapbox/pixelmatch
